Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.client

package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.client
Non-blocking HTTP client with an event-driven handler pattern.

This package provides an asynchronous HTTP client that integrates with Gumdrop's event-driven architecture. It supports HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2, connection multiplexing, server push, streaming bodies, and trailer headers.

Key Components

  • HTTPClient - Interface for making HTTP requests to a server
  • HTTPRequest - Represents a request to be sent
  • HTTPResponseHandler - Callback interface for receiving response events
  • HTTPResponse - Response status and redirect information
  • HTTPStatus - Symbolic HTTP status codes
  • PushPromise - HTTP/2 server push promise

Features

  • Non-blocking I/O using the shared SelectorLoop
  • HTTP/1.1 with keep-alive support
  • HTTP/2 with stream multiplexing and server push
  • Event-driven header delivery (including trailers)
  • Streaming request and response bodies
  • Backpressure support for large uploads
  • SSL/TLS with ALPN protocol negotiation
  • Automatic redirect following
  • Request cancellation
  • Authentication (Basic, Bearer, Digest, OAuth)

Usage Example


 // Simple GET request
 HTTPRequest request = client.get("/api/users");
 request.header("Accept", "application/json");
 request.send(new DefaultHTTPResponseHandler() {
     @Override
     public void ok(HTTPResponse response) {
         System.out.println("Success: " + response.getStatus());
     }

     @Override
     public void header(String name, String value) {
         System.out.println(name + ": " + value);
     }

     @Override
     public void responseBodyContent(ByteBuffer data) {
         // Process body chunk
     }

     @Override
     public void close() {
         System.out.println("Response complete");
     }
 });

 // POST with body
 HTTPRequest post = client.post("/api/users");
 post.header("Content-Type", "application/json");
 post.startRequestBody(handler);
 post.requestBodyContent(ByteBuffer.wrap(jsonBytes));
 post.endRequestBody();

 // Multiple concurrent requests (HTTP/2)
 if (client.getVersion() != null && client.getVersion().supportsMultiplexing()) {
     for (String path : paths) {
         client.get(path).send(handler);
     }
 }

Event Flow

For a successful response with body and trailers:

  1. ok(HTTPResponse) - status received
  2. header(name, value) - for each response header
  3. startResponseBody() - body begins
  4. responseBodyContent(ByteBuffer) - for each body chunk
  5. endResponseBody() - body complete
  6. header(name, value) - for each trailer header
  7. close() - response complete
Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Class
    Description
    DefaultHTTPResponseHandler
    Default implementation of HTTPResponseHandler with no-op methods.
    HTTPClient
    HTTP client implementation that creates and manages HTTP connections.
    HTTPClientConnection
    HTTP client connection that handles protocol-level communication.
    HTTPClientHandler
    Handler interface for HTTP client connection lifecycle events.

    Represents an HTTP request to be sent by an HTTP client.
    HTTPResponse
    Represents an HTTP response status delivered to an HTTPResponseHandler.

    Handler interface for receiving HTTP response events.

    Represents an HTTP/2 server push promise (PUSH_PROMISE frame).
